page.title: 02LOXWOOD, GENERAL SURVEY
page.content:
Loxwood is sometimes said to be the longest village in Sussex. It starts with a duck pond at Round Street and finishes at the Surrey border. {Only {the central area of the village forms {part of this survey}and amenities such as the Church, Village Hall, Police Station, Public Houses and the School lie to the North and East.
Included in this survey, however, is the{commercial centre}of the village, its Post Office and shops overlooking an ornamental Duck Pond, a Nursery and Market Garden and a telephone exchange. There is also a Newsagent and one or two small businesses operating from private houses.
